[Groovy] Class TaskValidationService

java.lang.Object
  org.objectrepository.instruction.TaskValidationService

class TaskValidationService

TaskValidationService Main purpose is to validate tasks and confirm status. Each task would require a different kind of validation. @author: Lucien van Wouw

hasChange

boolean hasChange(java.lang.Object currentDocument, java.lang.Object document)
getServices Each Workflow has a service that invokes it. Hence we also have a controller to invoke the service. Services become available when we have an ingest=pending state. The services is locked when a workflow is running: statusCode < 700 ( can be set via PlanConfig ) In all other cases the services is free to be called at a default instruction ingest status of 'pending'. Each service can be filtered in PlanConfig in the service: [ingest:[] ] setting These services are infused in the Instruction class, where other services, controllers and views can access via the getServices property.

hasFSInstruction

java.lang.Object hasFSInstruction(java.lang.Object document)
hasFSInstruction See if an instruction is on the fs ( status 200 ) or in the database ( status 800 ) The instruction ought to be valid XML and end with a closing or element
Parameters:

hasValidDBInstruction

protected boolean hasValidDBInstruction(java.lang.Object document)
hasValidDBInstruction True is the all files in the FileSet are valid. That is: there are no tasks All to-be-processed and invalid files have a task with statusCode.
Returns:
